Well guys guess what some people don't have the money for a pc and people still payed for the game and aren't getting crap but when we finally are getting an update *after 8 months* it gets delayed the night before it's supposed to come out so I would rather them focus on console then pc because keep in mind PC players constantly get updates

Edited March 23, 2019 by Vanamonde
First off, we dont "constantly" get updates.   Second, there has been at least 1 PC release which got delayed at the last minute.

A friendly reminder in regards to the development of the console version and game development in general:

1) The console version is being handled by Blitworks (a different game studio), not Squad.  So yes, it is entirely possible for all dev teams involved with KSP to focus on the console update and the 1.7 PC release simultaneously.  (However since Squad performs the public relations front for the console update on these forums, that seems to be the reason they take the flak about the console releases)
2) Even within a single dev team, it is possible for parallel tasks of work.  You could have artists making/refining new features or part revamps, coders tweaking behavior "under the hood", etc.  If the artist team releases a bunch of part revamp previews, that does not mean the coders are just sitting on their hands and not bug-fixing.
3) Console certification is apparently an expensive and thorough process, so if a console update gets pushed out and is "a little buggy", I suspect Blitworks can't feasibly turn around and push another update for some time, unless they go through another certification process.  This means that, without knowing what the technical issue is, you may have had to live with it for quite some time.  So be careful with what you with for.

On 3/14/2019 at 2:03 PM, SQUAD said:

Among the various bugs that are no more, these ones stand out:

We fixed a visual problem with the PQS normal maps that caused planets to have mismatched normals seams when seen from orbit. The team also fixed a bug where symmetry would break animations on some parts and another that locked the ‘Return to KSC’ button at the top of the altimeter during flight scenes. The thermal overlay that was rendering on parts with lights was also fixed, alongside a hilarious bug that caused the launchpad flagpole to explode when a Kerbal fell off the top of it.

I noticed no mention in this short paragraph of landing gear, landing struts, wheels ( and their associated well-known glitches with terrain ).

Also absent was the continuing problems with the Making History service module. I have been battling with this part for several days now, and have concluded it can only be used as a cosmetic part, like a spacer. It cannot be used for its intended purpose.

I believe priority seems to be paint jobs over part bugs.

Change my mind.
